issue.title: Global functions to set/get shared values from the root context
issue.body:
## Specific Demand

Dioxus should expose a global version of provide_root_context and a new global consume_root_context function. This would allow data stored in the root context to be treated similar to OnceCell, but with the added benefit of a guarantee that the data will be tied to the lifecycle of the context. 

This would be especially useful for building more complex add-ons to dioxus that run outside the VDom, but store data for contexts in the VDom. 

## Implement Suggestion

The with_runtime function already underpins the existing provide_root_context implementation. This could be used to power a new global version fairly easily.

issue.title: LiveView Router Integration
issue.body:
## Specific Demand

The LiveView renderer currently uses the desktop router history provider, which does not change the browser URL of the page

## Implement Suggestion

The integration should work similar to the web router feature, but with liveview applications. It can use the [query](https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/blob/master/packages/liveview/src/query.rs) system introduced in #894 to communicate with the browser

issue.title: LiveView Router Integration
issue.body:
## Specific Demand

The LiveView renderer currently uses the desktop router history provider, which does not change the browser URL of the page

## Implement Suggestion

The integration should work similar to the web router feature, but with liveview applications. It can use the [query](https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/blob/master/packages/liveview/src/query.rs) system introduced in #894 to communicate with the browser

comment.body: The git version of Dioxus now has router support for liveview thanks to DonAlonzo!

commits.message:
Implement LiveView Router Integration (#1505)

* Fix GoForwardButton calling can_go_back instead of can_go_forward

* Add first draft of LiveviewHistory

* Add external URL redirect

* Lock evaluator channel outside loop

* Add liveview to router examples

* fixup! Add liveview to router examples

* Communicate with liveview server on page load

* Add PopState event to Liveview routing

* Call updater callback from liveview history

* Add rudimentary PopState functionality to liveview router.

* Fix linter errors

* Refactor

* Fix navigator external redirection not working.

* Add go back and go forward buttons to router examples

* Finish functionality for timeline stack in liveview router

* Add docs to LiveviewHistory

* Replace Liveview history context attachment with constructor that takes context

* Fix go forward/backward history/future shuffle

* Support history across entire liveview session, if contiguous page jumps.

* Remove unnecessary bounds

* Add query and hash to location string

* Run rustfmt

* fix: Update server function docs link (#1489)

* liveview: Add `interpreter_glue_relative_uri (#1481)

* liveview: Add `interpreter_glue_relative_uri`

By utilizing `window.location.host` in the client-side JavaScript, we can easily derive the WebSocket URI from a relative path URI. This approach obviates the need for host address retrieval on the server side, unlike the method of serving glue code in liveview using `interpreter_glue`.

* liveview: Merge `.._relative_url` functionality

- Merged `.._relative_url` to current API `interpreter_glue`.
- Edit axum example to work with new feature.

* liveview: Fix clippy warning

* Rename modules to use snake_case (#1498)

* Change Scope into &ScopeState

* Move synchronization of state into router and make it opt-in

---------

Co-authored-by: Marc Espín <mespinsanz@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Seungwoo Kang <ki6080@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Leonard <tigerros.gh@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Evan Almloff <evanalmloff@gmail.com>

pull_request.title: Implement LiveView Router Integration
pull_request.body:
This is in response to #1038.

Included are two bug fixes:

- GoForwardButton used can_go_back to check if it should be disabled, now uses can_go_forward.
- Router context resolve_into_routable resolved all external URLs into an error string instead of the actual URL.

comment.body:
> This could prove to be hard, as security restrictions in browsers hinder programmatically getting any other information other than the state of the current page and the total number of pages in the stack. However, I think for this particular problem, with efficiency in mind, we can probably scale down the amount of information being sent drastically. I will investigate this further.

That makes sense, since it only transfers the history on the initial load, this shouldn't be much of a performance hit
